quotations.text: Rachel wepynge ffor her chyldren, and wolde nott be comforted because they were not.
To be, or not to be, that is the Questionnb....
it were great sottishnesse, and apparent false-hood, to say, that that is which is not yet in being, or that already hath ceased from being.
There is surely a peece of Divinity in us, something that was before the Elements, and owes no homage unto the Sun.
The genial hotel manager of the past is no more. Now owner of a trucking concern and living in Belgium, Rusesabagina says the horrors he witnessed in Rwanda "made me a different man."

definitions.text: (now, literary) To exist; to have real existence.

quotations.text: Some men there are loue not a gaping Pigge: / Some that are mad, if they behold a Cat: / And others, when the bag-pipe sings i'th nose, / Cannot containe their Vrine for affection.
"There is a sort of domestic enjoyment to be known even in a crowd, and this you had."

"There has been lots of commentary on who is staying and who is staying out and this weekend will be the real test," said one senior media buying agency executive who has pulled the advertising for one major client.

definitions.text: With (there) as dummy subject: to exist.

quotations.text: The cup is on the table.
When will the meeting be?
The postman has been today, but my tickets have still not yet come.
I have been to Spain many times.

definitions.text: (without predicate) elliptical form of "be here", "go to and return from" or similar.

quotations.text: I'm 20.

definitions.text: (copulative) Used to name the age of a subject.

quotations.text: Ignorance is bliss.

definitions.text: (copulative) Used to indicate that the subject and object are the same.

quotations.text: 3 times 5 is fifteen.

definitions.text: (copulative, mathematics) Used to indicate that the values on either side of an equation are the same.

quotations.text: François Mitterrand was president of France from 1981 to 1995.

definitions.text: (copulative) Used to indicate that the subject plays the role of the predicate nominal.

quotations.text: The sky is blue.

definitions.text: (copulative) Used to connect a noun to an adjective that describes it.

quotations.text: The sky is a deep blue today.

definitions.text: (copulative) Used to indicate that the subject has the qualities described by a noun or noun phrase.

quotations.text: The dog was drowned by the boy.
Study courses of Esperanto and Ido have been broadcast.

definitions.text: (auxiliary) Used to form the passive voice.

quotations.text: The woman is walking.
I shall be writing to you soon.
We liked to chat while we were eating.
In the possibility of radio uses of a constructed language — and such experiments are proving successful—vast sums of money and untold social forces may be involved.

definitions.text: (auxiliary) Used to form the continuous forms of various tenses.

quotations.text: ''They are not yet come back.'' (instead of the modern ''They have not yet come back.'')
‘I wish that he were come to me, / For he will come,’ she said.
He is not here; for he is risennb....
''The King with half the East at heel is marched from lands of morning;''

definitions.text: (archaic) Used to form the perfect aspect with certain intransitive verbs, most of which indicate motion. Often still used for "''to go''"

quotations.text: I am to leave tomorrow.
I would drive you, were I to obtain a car.

definitions.text: (auxiliary) Used to form future tenses, especially the future periphrastic.

quotations.text: This building is three hundred years old.
It is almost eight.
I am 75 kilograms.

definitions.text: Used to link a subject to a count or measurement.

quotations.text: It has been three years since my grandmother died.'' (similar to ''My grandmother died three years ago,'' but emphasizes the intervening period)
It had been six days since his departure, when I received a letter from him.

definitions.text: (With ''since'') used to indicate passage of time since the occurrence of an event.

quotations.text: It is hot in Arizona, but it is not usually humid.
Why is it so dark in here?

definitions.text: (often, impersonal) Used to indicate weather, air quality, or the like.

quotations.text: Women be shoppin'! You cannot stop a woman from shoppin'!

definitions.text: tend to do, often do; marks the habitual aspect.
